central_thesis: The Book of Power is a practical grimoire offering a collection of magical operations, talismans, and rituals designed to achieve diverse practical outcomes, ranging from protection and healing to invoking spirits for power, knowledge, and material effects. The underlying philosophy asserts that through precise execution of rituals, inscription of sigils, and invocation of genies, practitioners can manipulate reality and attain specific desires, emphasizing the critical role of exactness, materials, timing, and mental fortitude (absence of doubt and fear).

structure_content.chapter_title: Introductory Note
structure_content.summary: Idres Shah's transcription of an 18th-century Middle Eastern manuscript, noting its rarity, numerological content (likely ABJD), and the inclusion of his own footnotes (in italics) concerning Arabic renderings and context.

structure_content.chapter_title: I. To overcome enemies of every kind
structure_content.summary: A ritual involving writing a specific letter square (AIKN PRMC DHTR MMPM) on white cloth with red or black ink during the New Moon, carrying it, and speaking the word 'AIKAN' facing East, North, and West when wishing to overcome enemies.

structure_content.chapter_title: 2. To be revenged upon one that has done you hurt
structure_content.summary: At night, alone, speak 'RAIZINO' seven times to the points of the compass. Write a specific letter square (RAIZI IZIAR AZBGD BMMTM) on a dried, triangular leaf with a blue wood pen. Burn the leaf in a lamp flame that has not been out for more than three hours, ensuring no one is within three hundred paces. Carry black cord on the right arm.

structure_content.chapter_title: 3. The killing of men by magic
structure_content.summary: Describes two methods, noting its inherent evil. The first involves an iron-on-lead square (7x7 numerical value) hanged in a river for 49 days, then buried with a widow's tear, three river stones, and unused shoes. When required, burn a picture of the targets and speak 'EOO EOO EOO MMOO ADADBASANA'. The second involves writing a letter square (MMBAB BABMM MMBBA ABBMM) in white ink (clay/water) on black cloth for the victim to wear, while the killer writes it 25 times on green silk with black ink. Death occurs in 3 days if worn, 70 days if not.

structure_content.chapter_title: 4. To travel instantly from one place to another by magic
structure_content.summary: Invokes the genie AMPHAROOL (King of Genies of Flying). Five days after the Full Moon, collect five stones from sunless places. In a windy location, call 'AMPHA, ROLA, MPHAR, OLAM' loudly. The genie appears, offering a 'Ring of Travel' kept in a woollen bag and rubbed with quicksilver every 30 days. Alternatively, boil snow with oil over two woods, make powder from charcoal, place in horn, put a pinch in a book, wear the book, and say 'SISPI, SISPI' to fly. To return, say 'ITTSS, ITTSS'.

structure_content.chapter_title: 5. Protection from evil spirits and the mischievous
structure_content.summary: During any magical operation, write a specific letter square (SDDDC HTLTB SDDDC HTLTB) on paper and bind it to the left arm. This talisman is linked to King David and Solomon, attracting good spirits and teaching magical arts.

structure_content.chapter_title: 6. To stop any man, animal, boat or cart from moving
structure_content.summary: An Indian talisman. Write a specific numerical square (1 21 63 7, 21 7 1 21, 9 19 91 9, 12 4 6 8) on a green leaf with another leaf, using yellow ink. Hold the leaf in the left hand, look at the target, and quickly pronounce the numbers '1 21 63 7' followed by '12 4 6 8'. Requires absence of fear and doubt. The head must be covered, preferably with yellow cloth, and the ritual must not be discussed.

structure_content.chapter_title: 7. To cause love between two people
structure_content.summary: Take three strings (earth, sun, moon colors), tie them together, place in earthenware jar for six days, then add jasmine juice. The resulting ink is used to write a letter square (HBBNN RHBNR BRHBN NBHRB) on barley-steeped white cloth at the first hour of day. Place the finished square between two flat stones in a room for two nights, then say the names of the desired lovers loudly for three days.

structure_content.chapter_title: 8. To raise storms
structure_content.summary: Involves the mountain genie ARRIDU. Make a square with his name on metal with a red pen. Go to a deserted spot, face West, pick up four stones (one from front, one from each side), saying 'YARRIDO'. Place stones in a cotton bag on belt. Bathe with salted water, then place the stones on the genie's talisman to make him appear. Offer bread. To raise a storm, tell him the place and duration, and he will provide a white/red stone as a sign.

structure_content.chapter_title: 9. To cause discord between two people
structure_content.summary: Write a specific letter square (HDHDH IDIDI DHDHD DIDID) on lead with an iron point. Sew it into a leather cover and wear it around the neck. To cause discord, say 'ROUDMO' and 'PHARRUO' seven times to each cardinal direction, then say the targets' names and whisper 'FIGHT, FIGHT, ROUDMO'. To stop discord, say 'OMDOR'.

structure_content.chapter_title: 10. To speak to whomever you wish, when they are absent
structure_content.summary: Requires fasting for seven days (dawn to sunset, no water). Say specific numbers (1, 9, 2, 5, 4, 9, 6, 5, 3, 3) 49 times, facing all possible directions. Think intensely of the person. Take three vessels (full, half, empty water), drop pebbles (same numbers as before) until all vessels have equal pebbles. Say the numbers silently into the jars. Speak the message into each jar. For an answer, listen to a fourth empty jar; a cricket sound indicates an error. Repeat seven times for proficiency.

structure_content.chapter_title: 11. To overcome envy
structure_content.summary: If the enemy is known, take a small piece of liver, tie it in a scroll scrap, hang it near a fire, and look at it with anger. Write a numerical square (6 66 848 938, 8 11 544 839, 1 11 383 839, 2 73 774 447) on paper and burn it immediately. The envious person will dream of their mistake and seek forgiveness. If the person is far, repentance is known when the liver takes a crescent shape, then the spell is removed by rewriting the square and dissolving it in water while forgiving.

structure_content.chapter_title: 12. To gain the submission of men
structure_content.summary: Take a chain, hook, and three-finger-broad wood piece, tie them with a knotless cord, and bury them in an undisturbed hole. Write a charm (A EEE EEA, AFE EEE EEA, IIIIIIIII) on paper, gaze at it by lamp light for an hour each night, then boil it in clear water until dissolved. While looking at fingers, repeat '77-77-77-77- ANANANAN - KAKAKAKAKAK'.

structure_content.chapter_title: 13. To transmute metals
structure_content.summary: Requires specific talismans (158AO 7910A, 18500 8510A) inscribed on alchemical apparatus. These are to be written when the Sun or Moon is in Leo, with a pen like a pointed knife. Mix lead with half black powder, then half again red powder, with mercury under the sign of Leo. Heat for eight days and nights in a slow furnace, bind with cloth strips, enclose in earthenware, and inscribe 'D Z A B'. Purity of mind and body is essential. A witness (animal or man) must observe the gold. Part of the gold must be given to the poor.

structure_content.chapter_title: 14. To obtain the Elixir of Life
structure_content.summary: First, seek God's permission. Prepare with 40 days of fasting and meditation. Find a specific blue/red stone with a white line (abundant in African deserts). Make a copper/gold sheath for it, inscribed with a bird figure and 'LI LI LI NA NA AN'. Place the sheathed stone in running stream water, bury it for seven moon cycles. Bathe, eat nothing, then retrieve the stone. Say the words repeatedly, place on heart. Burn old clothes, don new green/white garments. Drink half the water (Water of Life), carry the other half. It is noted that beyond 200 years, one longs for death and must drink the remaining water to die at the appointed time.

structure_content.chapter_title: 15. To make camels fight together
structure_content.summary: Used in war. Draw two camels on stones of different colors with different inks. Make a hole, join with string. Write numbers of antipathy (2, 3, 9, 4) on one stone, and accursed numbers of infidelity (3, 333, 333) on the other. Swing them to make genies see them, causing camels to fight. To stop, say numbers of unity and mystery (1, 5, 7).

structure_content.chapter_title: 16. To be warm in the cold
structure_content.summary: Make a leather talisman, inscribe it with specific signs (--- ---, ---). Hang from the right arm. During a Full Moon, place it in the moon's rays, make the signs over it with your hand while closing your eyes, then pick it up. Wearing this amulet will keep one warm.

structure_content.chapter_title: 17. To become cool in the heat
structure_content.summary: Take a piece of red leather, draw specific signs (| ||||| | || -.) on it. At the sun's highest point, place the talisman in its rays, trace the marks with a finger and look at the sun. Keep the talisman wrapped in a cloth of gold until needed, then wear it under the armpit.

structure_content.chapter_title: 18. To be brave
structure_content.summary: Create a talisman from an elephant's tooth, inscribed with specific numbers (23 23 23 23, 58 85 88 55, 25 28 28 25, 52 82 82 52) at the fifth hour of the day using a pen made from a goat horn (from a goat slain the day before the new moon). Place the talisman in warm milk until the words dissolve, then drink the milk while saying 'SAMTDGKM' mentally.

structure_content.chapter_title: 19. To gain honour at court
structure_content.summary: Embroider specific signs (ADD7D7DADDA) in yellow silk inside a cap and wear it. Say 'YARA YARA ANTARA' (the genie's name/sign) fifteen times each night for seven days. The genie may appear, leaving a brown leaf and receiving honey, then leaving a white stone and a spear of iron from the seven mountains if asked. Do not thank the genie.

structure_content.chapter_title: 20. To become learned and respected
structure_content.summary: Polish a piece of brass (mirror) by dropping water on it for three nights. In a prepared room with a blank book, ink, and reed pen, tap the mirror seven times. The genie DUNA appears in the mirror. Call 'DUNA' and seek 'knowledge'. DUNA will write answers in the book without touching it. To memorize a book, ask DUNA. To make learning permanent, eat three eggs daily with salt before and after meals. Claiming credit for the knowledge is forbidden, as it acts against the genie.

structure_content.chapter_title: 21. To hear music whenever you want it
structure_content.summary: Call the genie EL-ADREL while wearing a metal cap. He appears from a pot of water on a table and will cause desired music. To cease, call his name backward. Only once per day.

structure_content.chapter_title: 22. To be provided with food by spirits
structure_content.summary: Place a finger-sized piece of glass over a green stone, over a fruit-bearing tree leaf. Write 'AM MA ES OM' in dust. Say 'AMESOM, come at once...' The genie appears, brings requested food. He will return for future calls after giving his name.

structure_content.chapter_title: 23. To cure all ills
structure_content.summary: Take black cloth from a 7-year sun-exposed wood cleft, place in a white vessel with beeswax. Heat slowly for two days. Add wheat, boil. Place mass in white cloth, hang until Full Moon. Take wax from this, place in molten lead, form a ring for the first finger. Inscribe 'AL OML LA' with an iron point. To use, wear the ring, put black cloth on head, face sick man. Man holds practitioner's hand with ring, repeats words. Ring then placed in water, water drunk by sick man for cure.

structure_content.chapter_title: 24. To become a proficient swordsman
structure_content.summary: Make small wax figures of soldiers and animals, and a larger figure of yourself with a sword. Break the swords of the other figures. Say 'AO AO AO APH'. Always carry the images for invincibility in combat.

key_concepts.definition: Geometric arrangements of letters or numbers believed to possess specific magical properties when inscribed and activated through ritual. The text features both letter-based (e.g., AIKN, RAIZI, MMBAB, HBBNN, SDDDC, HDHDH) and numerical squares (e.g., 1 21 63 7, 6 66 848 938, 23 23 23 23, 158AO 7910A) for various purposes.

Objects (cloth, leather, metal, stone, elephant tooth) inscribed with words, numbers, or symbols, often consecrated under specific astrological or lunar conditions, and carried or worn to achieve a desired magical effect. They are central to many operations in the book.

Spiritual entities or spirits that can be invoked and commanded by the practitioner to perform specific tasks, such as instant travel (AMPHAROOL), raising storms (ARRIDU), granting knowledge (DUNA), providing music (EL-ADREL), or furnishing food (AMESOM). Their names and invocation methods are crucial.

The practice of assigning occult significance to numbers, often linked to letters. The text explicitly references the Arabic 'ABJAD' (ABJD) notation system, where letters correspond to numerical values, influencing the construction and power of squares and words.

Specific verbal formulas, names of genies, or numerical sequences (e.g., 'AIKAN', 'RAIZINO', 'AMPHA, ROLA, MPHAR, OLAM', 'YARRIDO', 'ROUDMO', 'PHARRUO', 'OMDOR', 'SISPI', 'ITTSS', 'YARA YARA ANTARA', 'SAMTDGKM', 'AO AO AO APH', 'AL OML LA') that, when spoken correctly and often under specific conditions, activate magical effects or facilitate communication with spirits.

A principle where magic operates by imitation or correspondence. Examples include using a piece of liver for an envious enemy, or making wax figures to influence swordsmanship. The physical actions mirror the desired magical outcome.

A recurring prerequisite for successful magical operations. The text emphasizes fasting, mental/physical purity, and explicitly states that 'doubt is the destroyer of works of magic', highlighting the importance of unwavering belief and focus from the practitioner.

The precise conditions under which rituals must be performed, including lunar phases (New Moon, Full Moon, moon and a half), specific hours of the day, directions (East, North, West), and the use of particular materials (white cloth, red/black ink, specific woods, metals, stones, animal parts, fluids, etc.).

practical_system.description: The 'Book of Power' outlines a system of operative magic centered on the creation and activation of talismans and the evocation of various genies (spirits). Success is contingent upon strict adherence to precise ritual instructions, including specific materials, timing (lunar phases, hours), directional orientation, and verbal incantations (words of power, genie names, numerical sequences). The practitioner's internal state, characterized by purity, unwavering belief, and absence of doubt or fear, is paramount. The system leverages sympathetic magic, numerology (ABJD), and the commanding authority over genies for a wide array of practical outcomes.
tools: Magic Squares (various designs, letter-based and numerical)
Talismans (made from cloth, leather, metal, stone, elephant tooth, wax)
Writing implements (blue wood pen, iron point, goat horn pen, pointed knife)
Cloth (white, black, green silk, woollen bags, cloth of gold)
Metals (iron, lead, copper, gold, polished brass, silver coins)
Natural elements (stones, river stones, specific woods, leaves, snow, charcoal, liver, beeswax)
Containers (earthenware jar, white vessel, horn, book, glass, pot of water)
Liquids (water, oil, jasmine flower juice, warm milk)
Accessories (black cord, cap, yellow silk, mirror, blank book, reed pen)
rituals: Inscribing magic squares (numerical or letter-based) on various materials (cloth, metal, leather, paper, stone) at specific times (New Moon, Full Moon, Sun/Moon in Leo, fifth hour).

Speaking specific words of power or genie names (e.g., 'AIKAN', 'RAIZINO', 'AMPHA', 'ROLA', 'MPHAR', 'OLAM', 'SISPI', 'ITTSS', 'YARRIDO', 'ROUDMO', 'PHARRUO', 'OMDOR', 'YARA YARA ANTARA', 'AMESOM', 'SAMTDGKM', 'AO AO AO APH', 'AL OML LA') multiple times, often facing specific directions.
Collecting specific natural items: stones from sunless places, first three river stones, specific colored strings, leaves, wood from aged trees, liver, snow.
Processing materials: boiling snow with oil, making powder from charcoal, steeping cloth in barley water, preparing specific inks (white from clay/water, red/black, yellow).

Performing specific actions: burning leaves or pictures, burying talismans or ritual components, placing items in water for specific durations, bathing rituals, wearing talismans on specific body parts (heart, right arm, left arm, under armpit, around neck), making offerings to genies (honey, bread).

Internal preparation: fasting (e.g., 7 days without water, dawn-to-sunset), meditation (40 days), maintaining purity of mind and body, eliminating fear and doubt, and specific mental visualizations (e.g., thinking of the person to talk to, looking at the target with anger).

relevant_quotes.text: The Book of Power was originally transcribed by Idres Shah from an 18th century manuscript, and he speculates that it has come, whether in this current form or not, from the Middle Eastern magical tradition.
I cannot vouch for the accuracy of my Arabic renderings, but I have included them nonetheless.
There is great evil in killing by magic. It is not allowed by God, or man, and surely there cannot be any doubt on this point.
You must learn that doubt is the destroyer of works of magic, and thus be careful of your processes and your fear.
Know first, that none lives for longer than his span, save by the permission of God.
This is a stone, and it is not a stone; and those with wit will know.
This almost certainly refers to the 'ABJAD' (ABJD) notation system, shared by Hebrew and Arabic languages, in which every letter had a numerical equivalent.

There is one thing that takes away all honour, and that is if the person who is respected claims for himself any of the credit of having attained his learning, for that is an action against the genie who has given the knowledge.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Book of Power is a highly relevant text for the study of historical grimoire traditions, particularly those with Middle Eastern and Solomonic influences. It exemplifies a pragmatic, results-oriented approach to magic, deeply embedded in a system of correspondences, numerology (ABJD), and spirit communication. Its footnotes provide valuable academic context and critical commentary, making it a bridge between historical practice and modern scholarship. The text's emphasis on specific materials, timing, and the practitioner's internal state (e.g., 'doubt is the destroyer') offers insights into the operative mindset of past magical traditions, illuminating the mechanics behind such practices.
critical_analysis.target_audience: This book is primarily intended for academic researchers and serious practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism. It appeals to those with an interest in grimoire traditions, Solomonic magic, and the historical interplay between Arabic and Western magical systems. It would be of particular interest to scholars of comparative religion, folklore, and the history of science who explore magical texts as cultural artifacts. For the modern operative magician, it provides a raw, unadulterated glimpse into older systems, serving as a source for ritual components and philosophical underpinnings, though requiring significant interpretative work due to its archaic language and implied knowledge.
